noun.description: Zoology. Each of a series of axial elements in the primitive vertebrate fin (archipterygium) or forelimb.
Embryology. A mesodermal segment or somite; a protovertebra.
Embryology. A blastomere of medium size, produced by some forms of embryonic cleavage.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Huxley (1825–1895), biologist and science educationist. From meso- + -mere.
